intro: Nautilocalyx pictus, commonly known as the painted nautilocalyx, is a rare and striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in the rainforests of Borneo and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves that are often adorned with intricate patterns and vibrant colors. Its flowers are showy, with five petals that range from pink to deep red, and it produces small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
